contents.Text: [[[underline:Soft Purple]]] ≈ Start
[[[underline:Soft Yellow]]] ≈ Regenerate list
[[[underline:Dark Blue]]] ≈ Custom Order
[[[underline:Light Green]]] ≈ Cursor skip multiplier
[[[underline:Pale Orange]]] ≈ Cursor Mover
Starts the download process
Will be disabled apon download start (to avoid confusion about why there is a button that does nothing while downloading)
Regenerates the "Custom Order" list new results at the bottom of the list
Becomes Red indicating that the list needs to be regenerated before starting the download
Arrange your music by organizing a scrollable list of playlists or songs.
This feature deduplicates URLs, preventing duplicates across multiple sources such as artists and playlists.
To achieve this:
•Click on an item to select it (known as the cursor).
•Use the "Cursor Mover" buttons to rearrange the order.
•Ensures that any duplicate songs are downloaded into their respective artist folders instead of generic playlist folders.

•Keep in mind that placing an artist above a playlist means that duplicates within lower sources will be removed leaving the artist with the url before the download process begins, saving time and internet bandwidth.
Note: Duplicate songs in the downloaded music list will only be removed from the source above it in the order during the download process.
This multiplier affects the "Cursor Mover"
if the number is 2 when moving up and down using the "Cursor Mover"
it will move that many spaces in the "Custom Order"
Just change the number to how many spaces you want to move to speed up traversing in large lists
This moves selected items up or down in "Custom Order"
